result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State agrees.   As part of the agreement, case is dismissed and read in.

02:17 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Brandon Lee Merrill in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Ness  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   Attny Ness request to set for Plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.    Atty Ness indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
